article.name: Find and Customize Brandable Content
article.title: Find and Customize Brandable Content
article.body:
The brandable content feature allows you to create a branded theme and apply it to active training campaigns with eligible content. Use the Brandable Content tab to set your brand color, upload a company logo, and add an introduction and final page. These optional pages include your company logo, custom text, and an image of your choice. Use this feature to provide a familiar look and feel for your employees. Read the article below or watch this video to learn more.

Finding Brandable Content

In the ModStore, any content that can be branded has a Brandable Content label in the content description.

To find brandable content, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your account and select the ModStore tab.
  2. From the Browse tab, click Additional Filters
  3. From the Content Features drop-down menu, select Brandable Content to browse all content that can be branded.

Creating a Branded Theme

To create a brand theme, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your account and navigate to the ModStore tab.
  2. Select the Brandable Content tab.
  3. Click Add Branded Theme.
  4. Customize your branded theme. See Brand Customization for more information on customization options.
  5. Then, click Create. 

Now, you are ready to apply your theme.

Brand Customization

When creating a new branded theme or editing an existing one, there are three parts you can customize: Theme Settings, Introduction Page, and Final Page.

Theme Settings

When creating a new branded theme, Theme Settings is a required section. You can customize the overall look and feel of the theme by using the settings listed below.

  1. Theme Name: A theme name is required. This name will help you identify this theme and is displayed in your list of branded themes.
  2. Brand Color: Elements such as the progress bar, active text, and icons will display in this brand color. Enter the HEX code for your brand or click the square icon to the right of this field to open a color selector.
  3. Company Logo: Upload a logo to display at the bottom of the content menu and on the optional introduction and final pages. The image must be a PNG that is 200px wide and 100px tall.
    • For best results, use a logo with a transparent background.

The settings in the screenshot above will result in the following branded theme:

Introduction Page

The Introduction Page is optional and can be customized using the settings listed below.

  1. Page Heading: A heading is required for the introduction page. This field is limited to 100 characters.
  2. Page Text: Page text is required for the introduction page. This field is limited to 100 characters. 
  3. Panel Image: Upload an image to display on the left side of the introduction page. The image must be a PNG or JPG that is 512px wide and 768px tall.

The settings in the screenshot above will result in the following branded introduction page:

Final Page

The Final Page is optional and can be customized using the settings listed below.

  1. Page Heading: A heading is required for the final page. This field is limited to 100 characters.
  2. Page Text: Page text is required for the final page. This field is limited to 100 characters. 
  3. Panel Image: Upload an image to display on the left side of the final page. The image must be a PNG or JPG that is 512px wide and 768px tall.
  4. Phone Number & Email: Provide contact information so that users know who to reach out to with questions.
  5. Document and Policies: Select an icon from the Type drop-down menu, then enter your URL. We recommend editing the link description to the name of the document or policy because this text is displayed on the final page. 
    • You can add up to three links to related documents or policies.
  6. Social Media Links: Select an icon from the Platform drop-down menu. Then, enter your URL. Platform options include Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, Snapchat, Pinterest, and Slack.
    • You can add up to three links to social media pages.

The settings in the screenshot above will result in the following branded final page:

Managing Your Branded Themes

From the ModStore tab, select the Brandable Content tab. Here you will see a table that allows you to view and manage your branded themes. You can also apply these themes, create a new branded theme, and set your default branded theme.

  1. Set Default Theme drop-down menu allows you to set a default branded theme for all campaigns with eligible content. This will apply to any campaign that does not have a different theme selected.
  2. Branded Theme Name lists all branded themes. You can click on this or any other header to sort the table to your liking.
  3. Campaign Name lists all of the campaigns with the corresponding theme applied.
  4. Last Updated is the date on which the theme was last edited.
  5. Editopens a page showing the options selected when the theme was created. See Brand Customization for more details.
  6. Clone allows you to make a copy of the desired theme.
    • The created theme will still need to be applied to campaigns. It will not automatically be applied.
  7. Delete will delete the branded theme.
    • Any campaigns that had the deleted theme applied will revert back to the default theme.
    • If the default theme is deleted, all campaigns with this theme applied will revert back to the original, unbranded content.
    • This action cannot be undone.

Applying a Theme

This Apply Themes page lists all active training campaigns and the content within them. To navigate to this page, from the ModStore tab, select the Brandable Content tab. Then, click Apply Theme.

Note:To apply a branded theme, the brandable content must be part of an active Training Campaign. See our Training Campaigns and Content Management article for instructions on setting up a campaign.

  1. Hide campaigns without brandable content - Campaigns without Brandable Content are automatically hidden from view. You can choose to show these by clicking the switch at the top of the page.
  2. Theme - To apply a different theme than the default to a specific campaign, find the campaign in the list and select the desired theme from the drop-down menu.
  3. Preview- Once a theme is applied to a campaign, you can preview the content by clicking Preview and selecting a language.

images.alt:
The image displays the **"Brandable Content"** management screen within the **ModStore** application.

**Key UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Navigation:** The "Brandable Content" tab is active.
2.  **Top-Level Actions:** Two primary buttons are present: **"Apply Themes"** and **"Add Branded Theme."**
3.  **Default Theme Configuration:** A dedicated section, **"Set Default Theme,"** allows the selection of a system-wide default via a dropdown (currently set to **"Internal Branding for All Employees"**). Instructional text explains this theme applies automatically to campaigns without explicit themes.
4.  **Search:** A text input field labeled **"Search"** is provided for filtering the content list.
5.  **Data Table:** The main content is a sortable table detailing theme assignments with columns for **Branded Theme Name, Campaign Name,** and **Last Updated.**
6.  **Theme Status:** The theme **"Internal Branding for All Employees"** is visually tagged with a **"Default Theme"** badge.
7.  **Alerts:** An orange alert box confirms the default theme functionality: "Campaigns that do not have a theme selected and have eligible content will use this theme."
8.  **Row Actions:** Each row includes a set of action icons: Edit (pencil), Duplicate (two pages), and Delete (trash bin).

The image displays a user interface configuration section titled "**Theme Settings**," indicated by a bold header and an orange checkmark icon, with a collapse/expand caret on the right.

The interface is structured into two main columns:

1.  **Visual Preview (Left):** A static preview pane featuring basic UI wireframe elements (navigation lines and an image placeholder icon) against a white background, with the primary content area highlighted in a coral/salmon color, reflecting the theme settings being configured.

2.  **Configuration Fields (Right):** This section contains three input controls:

    *   **(1) Theme Name (Required):** A text input field labeled "Theme Name *" (asterisk denotes required status). The field is currently populated with the value "**Super Great Theme Name**."
    *   **(2) Brand Color:** An input field designated for color selection. It displays the HEX code value "**#0058DC**" and features an adjacent solid blue square swatch, likely serving as a color indicator or picker toggle.
    *   **(3) Company Logo:** A file upload control labeled "Company Logo (200px x 100px)," which specifies the required dimensions. The input field displays the placeholder text "**Please choose an image file**" next to a standard "**Browse**" button. Below the input, a small graphic placeholder labeled "**Your Logo**" confirms the purpose and location of the uploaded asset.
images.context: he overall look and feel of the theme by using the settings listed below.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface (UI) for a training course, featuring a left-hand navigation pane and a blurred main content area.

**Left Navigation Pane Details:**

*   **Course Progress:** Displays "Training Course" title with a progress bar indicating 1/3 completion.
*   **Navigation and Search:**
    *   A section titled "Table of Contents" with a dropdown indicator.
    *   A "Search:" field containing the placeholder text "Enter search term".
    *   A list of course pages:
        *   "Interesting Introduction Page" (highlighted blue, indicating current selection).
        *   "Introduction"
        *   "Fantastic Final Page"
*   **Ancillary Content:** Two clickable links/sections:
    *   "Glossary" (with a right arrow indicator).
    *   "References" (with a right arrow indicator).
*   **Training Options:**
    *   Section title: "Training Options:"
    *   An audio control button labeled "On" with a speaker icon.
*   **Branding/Footer:**
    *   A graphic featuring a gold ribbon badge labeled "#1" next to the text "Your Logo".
    *   A copyright notice: "© KnowBe4, Inc. All rights reserved." followed by version/build information: "B3.1.0-P3.2.0-alpha.3+db20c01.dirty-C0.0.0-alpha.1+7be593f.dirty".

**Main Content Area (Right Side):**

*   The content area is heavily blurred but appears to be a presentation slide or course page.
*   A central graphic featuring a stylized, orange-text warning: "THINK BEFORE YOU CLICK" is visible within a blue-bordered vertical panel.
*   Visible header text (blurred, blue color): "Interesting Introduction Page".
*   Placeholder logo/icon: A prominent yellow lightbulb icon next to the blurred text "Your Logo".
*   The overall layout suggests a standard e-learning module interface.

images.alt:
The image displays a section of a web form interface dedicated to configuring an introductory page.

**UI Context and Header:**
The section header is labeled **"Introduction Page (Optional)"** and is preceded by an orange checkmark icon, indicating a completed or configurable state. A chevron icon (up arrow) on the right confirms the section is a collapsible panel currently open for editing.

**Input Fields (Numbered Elements):**

1.  **Page Heading:** Labeled **"Page Heading \*."** The asterisk denotes a required field. This is a single-line text input field containing the value: **"Interesting Introduction Page."**
2.  **Page Text:** Labeled **"Page Text \*."** This is a required single-line text input field containing the value: **"Engaging page text."**
3.  **Left Panel Image:** Labeled **"Left Panel Image (512px x 768px)."** This is a file upload control field containing the filename: **"Left Side Panel 1.jpg."** An adjacent button labeled **"Browse"** is available for file selection. A small thumbnail preview of the uploaded image is displayed directly below the input field.

**Visual Representation (Left Panel):**
To the left of the input fields, a stylized graphical representation (in an orange-tinted mock-up) illustrates the layout being configured, showing placeholders for the main image, heading lines, and supplementary text/image elements.
images.context: ng> is optional and can be customized using the settings listed below.

images.alt:
The image displays a two-column web page structure used as an introduction screen.

**UI Elements and Navigation:**
1.  **Top Navigation:** A standard hamburger menu icon is present in the top-left corner, followed by the instructional text: "You can click here to open the menu."
2.  **Bottom Navigation:** A right-pointing chevron icon is located in the bottom-right corner, indicating content advancement or navigation to the next screen.

**Content Area (Left Pane):**
The left pane features a vertical, vintage-style poster designed for security awareness.
1.  **Visual Theme:** A graphic depiction of a head with dark hair and bright orange spikes, wearing glasses.
2.  **Primary Text:** The central message is conveyed in large, orange, block letters: "THINK BEFORE YOU CLICK."
3.  **Supporting Graphic:** A black mouse cursor icon is positioned near the word "CLICK."
4.  **Branding:** The security vendor logo "KnowBe4" is centered at the bottom, with the tagline "Human error. Conquered."

**Introduction Area (Right Pane):**
The right pane presents customizable introductory text and branding placeholders on a plain grey background.
1.  **Heading:** The main title is bold blue text: "Interesting Introduction Page."
2.  **Subtitle:** A descriptive line reads: "Engaging page text."
3.  **Placeholder Branding:** A placeholder trophy icon (yellow, marked with "#1") is displayed next to the blue placeholder text "Your Logo."
images.context: he screenshot above will result in the following branded introduction page:

images.alt:
This image displays a content configuration form used to define the elements of a structured informational page, limited by maximum constraints on linked items.

The top left includes a graphical wireframe preview indicating a layout featuring a prominent left image panel and right-aligned text/content.

**1. Page Heading Configuration**
*   **Field:** `Page Heading *` (Required field indicated by asterisk).
*   **Value:** `Fantastic Final Page`.

**2. Page Text Configuration**
*   **Field:** `Page Text *` (Required field).
*   **Value:** `Informative Page Text...`

**3. Left Panel Image Configuration**
*   **Field:** `Left Panel Image (512px x 768px)` (Includes size requirement).
*   **Input Control:** A file selection bar showing placeholder text `Please choose an image file` and a functional `Browse` button.
*   **Current Selection:** A small preview image is displayed, showing a graphic related to "RANSOMWARE GAME OVER."

**4. Contact Information Fields**
*   **Field:** `Phone Number`.
*   **Value:** `800-867-5209`.
*   **Field:** `Email`.
*   **Value:** `Awesome@Training.US`.

**5. Documents and Policies Section**
*   **Section Title:** `Documents and Policies (Max 3)`.
*   **New Entry Controls:** Three input fields are available for adding links: a `Type` dropdown, a `Link Description` text input, and an `Enter a URL` text input, followed by an `Add` button.
*   **Existing Entries:** Two links are currently configured:
    *   `Dress Code Policy PDF` (preceded by a PDF icon).
    *   `Employee Handbook` (preceded by a general document icon).
*   Each existing entry includes a removal icon ('x') on the right.

**6. Social Media Links Section**
*   **Section Title:** `Social Media Links (Max 3)`.
*   **New Entry Controls:** Three input fields are available: a `Platform` dropdown, a `Link Description` text input, and an `Enter a URL` text input, followed by an `Add` button.
*   **Existing Entries:** Two links are currently configured:
    *   `Facebook` (preceded by the standard Facebook 'f' icon).
    *   `LinkedIn` (preceded by the standard LinkedIn 'in' icon).
*   Each existing entry includes a removal icon ('x') on the right.
images.context: e is optional and can be customized using the settings listed below.

images.alt:
This image depicts the final page of a technical training module, utilizing a two-column layout under a universal navigation menu (represented by a hamburger icon).

**Left Column (Graphical Training Module Summary):**
A large, vertical graphic styled after retro 8-bit arcade games (Space Invaders motif) serves as the primary visual element.

1.  **Statistics Bar:** Displays three key metrics in red pixel font:
    *   MALWARE DETECTED: 9478450
    *   USER CLICKS: 34810150
    *   PHISHING ATTACKS: 4630800
2.  **Title:** The word "RANSOMWARE" is displayed prominently in large yellow pixel lettering.
3.  **Game Scene:** Features various pixelated alien sprites (three green, three blue/red) and an orange turret figure firing a magenta projectile.
4.  **Conclusion Text (White Pixel Font):** Includes the phrases "SECURITY AWARENESS TRAINING" and "GAME OVER FOR RANSOMWARE."
5.  **Branding:** The KnowBe4 logo and tagline ("Human error. Conquered.") are visible at the bottom.

**Right Column (Informational and Completion Interface):**
This section contains standard webpage UI elements for information dissemination and course completion.

1.  **Header and Body Text:** Main header is "Fantastic Final Page," followed by generic placeholder text "Informative Page Text..."
2.  **Contact Information:** Displays a telephone number (800-867-5209) and an email address (Awesome@Training.US), each preceded by a corresponding icon.
3.  **Document Links:** Two blue hyperlinked document links are presented, accompanied by document icons: "Dress Code Policy PDF" and "Employee Handbook."
4.  **Social Media Links:** Standard Facebook (f) and LinkedIn (in) icons are present, indicating external links.
5.  **Branding/Award Placeholder:** A gold ribbon graphic (#1) is shown alongside the placeholder text "Your Logo."
6.  **Call to Action (CTA) Section:**
    *   Instructional Text: "Please exit the course to complete the training."
    *   Button: A large, solid blue rectangular button labeled "Complete Training" serves as the final interaction point.

The settings in the screenshot above will result in the following branded final page:

images.alt:
This image displays the "Brandable Content" section of the "ModStore" application UI, dedicated to managing branded themes for campaigns.

**Overall Context and Navigation:**
* The page title is "Brandable Content."
* The primary navigation shows "ModStore," "Browse," and the selected tab, "Brandable Content."
* Action buttons in the upper right corner are **"Apply Themes"** (icon: stylized funnel/wrench) and **"Add Branded Theme"** (icon: plus sign).

**Section 1: Default Theme Configuration:**
* A box labeled **(1) "Set Default Theme"** allows the user to define a fallback theme.
* Descriptive text states: "The default theme will be automatically applied to campaigns that do not have a theme selected and have eligible content."
* A dropdown menu to the right is currently set to "Internal Branding for All Employees."

**Content Management/Table View:**
* Below the default theme section is a search bar labeled "Search."
* The content is presented in a sortable table with the following column headers:
    * **(2) Branded Theme Name** (currently sorting by this column, indicated by a down arrow icon).
    * **(3) Campaign Name**.
    * **(4) Last Updated** (date and time format).

**Table Row Data and Indicators:**
* **Row 1:**
    * Theme Name: "Internal Branding for US Employees"
    * Campaign Name: "2020 Security Awareness Initiative - US"
    * Last Updated: "04/22/2020 1:59 PM"
* **Row 2 (Default Theme):**
    * Theme Name: "Internal Branding for All Employees"
    * A beige tag next to the theme name reads **"Default Theme"**.
    * An orange notification box replaces the Campaign Name column, stating: "Campaigns that do not have a theme selected and have eligible content will use this theme."
    * Last Updated: "04/22/2020 1:58 PM"
* **Row 3:**
    * Theme Name: "External Branding for Contractors"
    * Campaign Name: "Email Security Training Campaign"
    * Last Updated: "04/21/2020 12:03 PM"

**Action Icons (5, 6, 7):**
Each row includes a set of three action icons located under the "Last Updated" column, separated by vertical lines:
* **(5) Edit:** Stylized pencil icon.
* **(6) Duplicate/Copy:** Stacked squares icon.
* **(7) Delete:** Trash bin icon.
images.context: so apply these themes, create a new branded theme, and set your default branded theme.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface page titled "Apply Themes" within the "ModStore" application, indicated by the primary navigation where "Brandable Content" is the active tab.

The page includes a persistent navigation link labeled "← Back to Brandable Content" in the upper right.

Below the title, a UI setting utilizes an active (blue) toggle switch (1) labeled "Hide campaigns without brandable content."

The main screen content is presented in a data table format, featuring three columns: **Campaign Name** (sortable), **Theme**, and **Content**.

One campaign, "2020 Security Awareness Initiative - US," is listed. Associated with this campaign is a Theme selection dropdown menu (2), which currently shows the partially truncated value: "Internal Branding for US Empl..."

Under the Content column, two separate items are listed for the single campaign: "2020 Common Threats" and "2020 Kevin Mitnick Security Awareness Training - 15 min." Each content item includes a corresponding "Preview" action link (3) with a dropdown arrow, indicating additional viewing or customization options.
